H0.text: Thymus gland is the location where T cells mature.

H1.text: Liver is the organ where T cells mature.

H2.text: Bone marrow is where T cells mature.

H3.text: Pituitary gland is where T cells mature.

A4.text: The thymus facilitates the maturation of T cells, an important part of the immune system providing cell-mediated immunity.

A5.text: T cells begin as hematopoietic precursors from the bone-marrow, and migrate to the thymus, where they are referred to as thymocytes.
